thread.title: Cabinet nods $10 billion 'Bangladesh Sovereign Wealth Fund' by forex reserves
thread.title_full: Cabinet nods $10 billion 'Bangladesh Sovereign Wealth Fund' by forex reserves

title: Cabinet nods $10 billion 'Bangladesh Sovereign Wealth Fund' by forex reserves
text:
Cabinet nods $10 billion 'Bangladesh Sovereign Wealth Fund' by forex reserves Senior Correspondent, bdnews24.com Published: 2017-02-06 15:51:14.0 BdST Updated: 2017-02-06 15:51:14.0 BdST The government has given its initial approval for the 'Bangladesh Sovereign Wealth Fund', which will be funded from the forex reserves. 
Monday's weekly Cabinet meeting nodded the proposal for the fund with an authorised capital of $10 billion. 
Cabinet Secretary Mohammad Shafiul Alam told the media that the government will be able to used the fund for 'any purposes for the sake of public interest.' 
He said that the fund will be formed in five years by contributing $2 billion each year from the forex reserves. "If our reserves stand at something between 30 to 32 billion dollars, then a 2-billion dollar withdrawal will not adversely affect the economy." 
More to follow
